On 5/27/09 8:47 AM, bowser.richard wrote:
> Now heritrix (again) works unde=
r Ubuntu 9.04!

yay!

> How do I recover plaintext archived files?

W/ARC f=
iles have "plaintext" header entries matching:

  Content-Type: text/plain
=

you can parse your records directly using zcat and the
tool of your choice=
, using the arcreader shell script
distributed with Heritrix:

  # get "tex=
t/plain" offsets from CDX
  bin/arcreader ${my_arc} | grep text/plain

  # =
get a text/plain record
  bin/arcreader --format=3Ddump --offset=3D12345678=
9 ${my_arc}

or, use the ARCReader class directly, roughly:

  ArchiveReade=
r a =3D ArchiveReaderFactory.get(myArc);
  for (ArchiveRecord r : a) {
    =
if (r.getHeader().getMimetype().equals('text/plain')) {
      r.dump();
   =
 }
  }

hope that helps...


/siznax
